maml:description.maml:para: Exports the Visual C++ Redistributables JSON manifest to an external file.
Reads the Visual C++ Redistributables JSON manifests included in the VcRedist module and exports the JSON to an external file. This enables editing of the JSON manifest for custom scenarios.
Path to the JSON file the content will be exported to.
Path to the JSON file the content will be exported to.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Export the list of supported Visual C++ Redistributables to C:\Temp\VisualCRedistributables.json.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns the installed Visual C++ Redistributables.

Queries the registry to find the installed Visual C++ Redistributables on the local system and returns the list to the pipeline. This includes the primary Redistributable entries by default and can export the additional and minimum Redistributable components also listed in the Registry.
Export all installed Redistributables including the Additional and Minimum Runtimes typically hidden from Programs and Features.
Export all installed Redistributables including the Additional and Minimum Runtimes typically hidden from Programs and Features.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Returns the installed Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables from the current system.
Description: Returns the installed Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables from the current system including the Additional and Minimum Runtimes.

maml:description.maml:para: Queries Microsoft Intune for the list Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables imported by VcRedist.

Queries Microsoft Intune for the list Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables imported by VcRedist and returns the list to the pipeline. This function will only return those Visual C++ Redistributable packages in Intune imported by VcRedist.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Queries Microsoft Intune for the Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables packages and returns them to the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: Returns an object of Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables for use with other VcRedist functions.
This function reads the Visual C++ Redistributables listed in an internal manifest (or an external JSON file) into an object that can be passed to other VcRedist functions.

A complete listing of the supported and all known redistributables is included in the module. By default, Get-VcList will only return a list of the supported Visual C++ Redistributables. To return any of the unsupported Redistributables, the -Export parameter is required with the output filtered with Where-Object.
The internal manifest can be exported with Export-VcManifest.
Specifies the release (or version) of the redistributables to return.
Specifies the processor architecture to of the redistributables to return. Can be x86 or x64.
Provide a path to an external VcRedist manifest file.
Defines the list of Visual C++ Redistributables to export - All, Supported or Unsupported Redistributables. Defaults to exporting the Supported Redistributables.
Specifies the release (or version) of the redistributables to return.
Specifies the processor architecture to of the redistributables to return. Can be x86 or x64.
Provide a path to an external VcRedist manifest file.
Defines the list of Visual C++ Redistributables to export - All, Supported or Unsupported Redistributables. Defaults to exporting the Supported Redistributables.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Return an object of the supported Visual C++ Redistributables from the embedded manifest.
Description: Returns the supported 2012, 2013 and 2022, x86 and x64 versions of the supported Visual C++ Redistributables from the embedded manifest.
Description: Returns a list of the all Visual C++ Redistributables from the embedded manifest, including unsupported versions.
Description: Returns the full list of supported Visual C++ Redistributables from the embedded manifest. This is the same as running Get-VcList with no parameters.
Description: Returns the full list of unsupported Visual C++ Redistributables from the embedded manifest and filters for the 2008 versions of the Redistributables.
Description: Returns the 2013 and 2019 x86 Visual C++ Redistributables from the list of supported Redistributables in the embedded manifest.
Description: Returns a list of the Visual C++ Redistributables listed in the external manifest VisualCRedistributables.json.

maml:navigationLink.maml:linkText: Get the list of Visual C++ Redistributables:

maml:description.maml:para: Creates Visual C++ Redistributable applications in a ConfigMgr site.

Creates an application in a Configuration Manager site for each Visual C++ Redistributable and includes setting whether the Redistributable can run on 32-bit or 64-bit Windows and the Uninstall key for detecting whether the Redistributable is installed.
Use Get-VcList and Save-VcRedist to download the Redistributable and create the array of Redistributables for importing into ConfigMgr.
Applications will be imported into the ConfigMgr with the default properties similar to the following:

Location: Applications\VcRedists Name: Visual C++ Redistributable 2019 x86 14.28.29913.0 Administrator comments: Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable 2019 x86 14.28.29913.0 imported by Import-VcConfigMgrApplication Publisher: Microsoft Software version: 14.28.29913.0 Language: en-US Date published: 18/03/2021 Localized application name: Visual C++ Redistributable 2019 x86 14.28.29913.0 User documentation: https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/vs/support/ Link text: https://www.visualstudio.com/downloads/ Privacy URL: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521839 Keywords: Visual C++ Redistributable

Deployment type: Name: SCRIPT_Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2019 Technology: Script Installer Administrator comments: Generated by Import-VcConfigMgrApplication Content location: \configmgr\Applications\VcRedists\2019\14.28.29913.0\x86\ Installation program: VC_redist.x86.exe /install /quiet /norestart Uninstall program: "%ProgramData%\Package Cache\{03d1453c-7d5c-479c-afea-8482f406e036}\VC_redist.x86.exe" /uninstall /quiet /noreboot Detection method: (Registry path)

An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Save-VcRedist. Save-VcRedist adds the Path property, that points to the installer executable, to the array exported from Get-VcList.
Specify a UNC path where the Visual C++ Redistributables will be distributed from
Specify the Site Code for ConfigMgr app creation.
Import the Visual C++ Redistributables into a sub-folder. Defaults to "VcRedists".
Optionally specify a publisher string to use in the Configuration Manager application.
Specify a keyword or keywords to add to the Configuration Manager application.
Add a completely silent command line install of the VcRedist with no UI. The default install is passive.
Do not copy the Visual C++ Redistributable binaries when importing applications into Configuration Manager.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Save-VcRedist. Save-VcRedist adds the Path property, that points to the installer executable, to the array exported from Get-VcList.
Specify a UNC path where the Visual C++ Redistributables will be distributed from
Specify the Site Code for ConfigMgr app creation.
Import the Visual C++ Redistributables into a sub-folder. Defaults to "VcRedists".
Add a completely silent command line install of the VcRedist with no UI. The default install is passive.
Do not copy the Visual C++ Redistributable binaries when importing applications into Configuration Manager.
Optionally specify a publisher string to use in the Configuration Manager application.
Specify a keyword or keywords to add to the Configuration Manager application.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Download the supported Visual C++ Redistributables to "C:\Temp\VcRedist", copy them to "\server\share\VcRedist" and import as applications into the ConfigMgr site LAB.

maml:description.maml:para: Packages the Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable installers into intunewin format and imports as applications into a Microsoft Intune tenant.

Creates an application in a Microsoft Intune tenant for each Visual C++ Redistributable and includes properties such as target Silent command, Uninstall command, Detection (via Registry) and Requirements.
Use Get-VcList and Save-VcRedist to download the Redistributables and create the array for importing into Microsoft Intune.

An application package will be created for each Visual C++ Redistributable with properties including Name, Description, Publisher, App Version, Information URL, Privacy URL, Notes, Logo, Install command, Uninstall command, Install behavior, Operating system architecture, Minimum operating system, and Detection rules.

This function requires the IntuneWin32App PowerShell module and supported Windows PowerShell only. Before using this function to import the Redistributables into an Intune tenant, authenticate first with Connect-MSIntuneGraph.

An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Save-VcRedist. Save-VcRedist adds the Path property, that points to the installer executable, to the array exported from Get-VcList.

An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Save-VcRedist. Save-VcRedist adds the Path property, that points to the installer executable, to the array exported from Get-VcList.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Authenticates to the specified tenant, retrieves the list of Visual C++ Redistributables 2022 version, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist and imports each Redistributable into the target Intune tenant as separate application.

Description: Authenticates to the specified tenant using an Azure AD app registration for non-interactive authentication, retrieves the supported list of Visual C++ Redistributables, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist and imports each Redistributable into the target Intune tenant as separate application.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates Visual C++ Redistributable applications in a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit share.
Creates an application in a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit share for each Visual C++ Redistributable and includes properties such as target Silent command line, Platform and Uninstall key.
Use Get-VcList and Save-VcRedist to download the Redistributables and create the array for importing into MDT.
Applications will be imported into the MDT Deployment share with the default properties similar to the following:

Location: Applications\VcRedists Name: Visual C++ Redistributable 2019 x86 14.28.29913.0 Comments: Generated by Import-VcMdtApplication Short name: Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2019 x86 Version: 14.28.29913.0 Publisher: Microsoft Language: en-US Source directory: .\Applications\Microsoft VcRedist\2019\14.28.29913.0\x86 Quiet install command: .\VC_redist.x86.exe /install /quiet /norestart Working directory: .\Applications\Microsoft VcRedist\2019\14.28.29913.0\x86 Uninstall registry key name: {03d1453c-7d5c-479c-afea-8482f406e036} Hide this application in the Deployment Wizard: Yes

An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Save-VcRedist. Save-VcRedist adds the Path property, that points to the installer executable, to the array exported from Get-VcList.
The local or network path to the MDT deployment share.
Specify a folder within the Applications node that the VcRedists will be imported into. Defaults to 'VcRedists'.
Optionally specifiy a name for the PSDrive to use when connecting to the MDT deployment share.
Optionally specify a publisher string to use in the MDT application.
Optionally specify the language property applied to the MDT application.
Add a completely silent command line install of the VcRedist with no UI. The default install is passive.
Specify that the option 'Hide this application in the Deployment Wizard' is not selected.
Force the import and overwrite of an existing application in the MDT deployment share.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Save-VcRedist. Save-VcRedist adds the Path property, that points to the installer executable, to the array exported from Get-VcList.
The local or network path to the MDT deployment share.
Specify a folder within the Applications node that the VcRedists will be imported into. Defaults to 'VcRedists'.
Add a completely silent command line install of the VcRedist with no UI. The default install is passive.
Specify that the option 'Hide this application in the Deployment Wizard' is not selected.
Force the import and overwrite of an existing application in the MDT deployment share.
Optionally specifiy a name for the PSDrive to use when connecting to the MDT deployment share.
Optionally specify a publisher string to use in the MDT application.
Optionally specify the language property applied to the MDT application.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Retrieves the list of Visual C++ Redistributables, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist and imports each Redistributable into the MDT deployment share at \server\deployment.

Description: Retrieves the list of supported and unsupported Visual C++ Redistributables in the variable $VcList, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist, imports each Redistributable into the MDT deployment share at \server\deployment and creates an application bundle.

maml:description.maml:para: Installs the Visual C++ Redistributables on the local system.

Installs the Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables from a list created by Get-VcList and downloaded into a folder structure locally with Save-VcRedist. Supports both passive and silent installation of the Redistributables. Useful for Windows deployments including creating gold images via HashiCorp Packer where the Redistributables can be downloaded and installed at runtime.

An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Save-VcRedist. Save-VcRedist adds the Path property, that points to the installer executable, to the array exported from Get-VcList.
Perform a completely silent install of the VcRedist with no UI. The default install is passive.
Perform an installation of a Visual C++ Redistributable even if it is already installed on the local system.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Save-VcRedist. Save-VcRedist adds the Path property, that points to the installer executable, to the array exported from Get-VcList.
Perform a completely silent install of the VcRedist with no UI. The default install is passive.
Perform an installation of a Visual C++ Redistributable even if it is already installed on the local system.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Installs the 2013 and 2019 64-bit Visual C++ Redistributables listed in $VcRedists and downloaded to C:\Temp\VcRedists.
Description: Installs only the 64-bit 2012, 2013 and 2017 Visual C++ Redistributables listed in $VcRedists and downloaded to C:\Temp\VcRedists.
Description: Installs all supported Visual C++ Redistributables using a completely silent install.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates Visual C++ Redistributable applications in a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit share.
Creates an application in a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit share for each Visual C++ Redistributable and includes properties such as target Silent command line, Platform and Uninstall key.
Use Get-VcList and Save-VcRedist to download the Redistributables and create the array for importing into MDT.
The bundle will be imported into the MDT Deployment share with the default properties similar to the following:

Location: Applications\VcRedists Name: Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables Comments: Application bundle for installing Visual C++ Redistributables. Generated by New-VcMdtBundle Short name: Visual C++ Redistributables Version:2021-Mar-18 Publisher: Microsoft Language: en-US Dependencies: (VcRedists in the MDT share)
The local or network path to the MDT deployment share.
Import the Visual C++ Redistributables into a sub-folder. Defaults to "VcRedists".
Optionally specifiy a name for the PSDrive to use when connecting to the MDT deployment share.
Optionally specify a publisher string to use in the MDT bundle.
Optionally specify a custom name for the MDT bundle.
Optionally specify the language property applied to the MDT application.
Force the import and overwrite of an existing bundle in the MDT deployment share.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Retrieves the list of Visual C++ Redistributables, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist and imports each Redistributable into the MDT deployment share at \server\deployment.

Description: Retrieves the list of supported and unsupported Visual C++ Redistributables in the variable $VcList, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist, imports each Redistributable into the MDT deployment share at \server\deployment and creates an application bundle.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables imported into Microsoft Intune via Import-VcIntuneApplication. Accepts a list of Visual C++ Redistributables from Get-VcList, queries Intune for matching Visual C++ Redistributables, and removes them from Intune.

Removes Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables imported into Microsoft Intune via Import-VcIntuneApplication. Accepts a list of Visual C++ Redistributables from Get-VcList, queries Intune for matching Visual C++ Redistributables, and removes them from Intune.
An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Get-VcList or Save-VcRedist.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
An array containing details of the Visual C++ Redistributables from Get-VcList or Save-VcRedist.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Queries Microsoft Intune for the Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables 2017 packages and removes them.

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads the Visual C++ Redistributables from an manifest returned by Get-VcList. The output from Get-VcList is modified by adding the path to the Redistributable installer in the Path property. This output can then be passed to other functions that require the downloaded installer.

Downloads the Visual C++ Redistributables from an manifest returned by Get-VcList into a folder structure that represents release, version and processor architecture. If the redistributable exists in the specified path, it will not be re-downloaded.
For example, the following folder structure will be created when downloading the 2010, 2012, 2013 and 2019 Redistributables to C:\VcRedist:
Specifies the array that lists the Visual C++ Redistributables to download.
Specify a target folder to download the Redistributables to, otherwise use the current folder.
Specifies a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.
Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Force the use of Invoke-WebRequest instead of Start-BitsTransfer. Included for backwards compatibility only.
Force the priority when using Start-BitsTransfer. Included for backwards compatibility only.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Instructs Invoke-WebRequest used by this function to display progress.
Specifies a user agent string for the web request.
The default user agent is similar to the below with slight variations for each operating system and platform.

Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Darwin 22.2.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.2.0: Fri Nov 11 02:04:44 PST 2022; root:xnu-8792.61.2~4/RELEASE_ARM64_T8103; en-AU) AppleWebKit/534.6 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/7.0.500.0 Safari/534.6
To test a website with the standard user agent string that's used by most internet browsers, use the properties of the PSUserAgent class, such as Chrome, FireFox, InternetExplorer, Opera, and Safari.
For example, the following command uses the user agent string for Internet Explorer: Save-EvergreenApp -UserAgent ([Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.PSUserAgent]::InternetExplorer)
Specifies the array that lists the Visual C++ Redistributables to download.
Specify a target folder to download the Redistributables to, otherwise use the current folder.
Force the use of Invoke-WebRequest instead of Start-BitsTransfer. Included for backwards compatibility only.
Force the priority when using Start-BitsTransfer. Included for backwards compatibility only.
Specifies a proxy server for the request, rather than connecting directly to the internet resource. Enter the URI of a network proxy server.
Specifies a user account that has permission to use the proxy server that is specified by the Proxy parameter. The default is the current user.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Darwin 22.2.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.2.0: Fri Nov 11 02:04:44 PST 2022; root:xnu-8792.61.2~4/RELEASE_ARM64_T8103; en-AU) AppleWebKit/534.6 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/7.0.500.0 Safari/534.6

For example, the following command uses the user agent string for Internet Explorer: Save-EvergreenApp -UserAgent ([Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.PSUserAgent]::InternetExplorer)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Downloads the supported Visual C++ Redistributables to C:\Redist.
Description: Passes the list of supported Visual C++ Redistributables to Save-VcRedist and downloads the Redistributables to C:\Redist.
Description: Passes the list of 2013 and 2019 x86 supported Visual C++ Redistributables to Save-VcRedist and downloads the Redistributables to C:\Redist.

Description: Downloads the 2010, 2012, 2013, and 2019 Visual C++ Redistributables to C:\Redist using the proxy server 'proxy.domain.local'

Tests that the downloads for the Visual C++ Redistributables as listed in the manifest returned by Get-VcList are available (i.e. return a HTTP 200 response).
A true or false value is returned for each Visual C++ Redistributables passed to the function.

Specifies the processor architecture to of the redistributables to uninstall. Can be x86 or x64.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates Visual C++ Redistributable applications in a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit share.
Creates an application in a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit share for each Visual C++ Redistributable and includes properties such as target Silent command line, Platform and Uninstall key.
Use Get-VcList and Save-VcRedist to download the Redistributables and create the array for importing into MDT.
Applications will be updated in the MDT Deployment share with the default properties similar to the following:

Location: Applications\VcRedists Name: Visual C++ Redistributable 2019 x86 14.28.29913.0 Comments: Generated by Import-VcMdtApplication Short name: Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2019 x86 Version: 14.28.29913.0 Publisher: Microsoft Language: en-US Source directory: .\Applications\Microsoft VcRedist\2019\14.28.29913.0\x86 Quiet install command: .\VC_redist.x86.exe /install /quiet /norestart Working directory: .\Applications\Microsoft VcRedist\2019\14.28.29913.0\x86 Uninstall registry key name: {03d1453c-7d5c-479c-afea-8482f406e036} Hide this application in the Deployment Wizard: Yes

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Retrieves the default list of supported Visual C++ Redistributables, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist and imports each Redistributable into the MDT deployment share at \server\deployment.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $VcList = Get-VcList -Export All Save-VcRedist -VcList $VcList -Path C:\Temp\VcRedist Import-VcMdtApp -VcList $VcList -Path C:\Temp\VcRedist -MdtPath \\server\deployment -Bundle

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Retrieves the list of supported and unsupported Visual C++ Redistributables in the variable $VcList, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist, imports each Redistributable into the MDT deployment share at \server\deployment and creates an application bundle.

maml:description.maml:para: Updates Visual C++ Redistributable application bundles in a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit share.

After importing or adding Visual C++ Redistributable applications in a Microsoft Deployment Toolkit share, an existing application bundle can be updated with GUIDs for the new Visual C++ Redistributable applications.
The bundle will be updated into the MDT Deployment share with the default properties similar to the following:

Location: Applications\VcRedists Name: Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributables Comments: Application bundle for installing Visual C++ Redistributables. Generated by New-VcMdtBundle Short name: Visual C++ Redistributables Version:2021-Mar-18 Publisher: Microsoft Language: en-US Dependencies: (VcRedists in the MDT share)
The local or network path to the MDT deployment share.
Optionally specifiy a name for the PSDrive to use when connecting to the MDT deployment share.
Optionally specify a publisher string to use in the MDT application. Defaults to "Microsoft".
Optionally specify a custom name for the MDT bundle. Defaults to "Visual C++ Redistributables".
A sub-folder of Applications that the Visual C++ Redistributables are in. Defaults to "VcRedists".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
The local or network path to the MDT deployment share.
A sub-folder of Applications that the Visual C++ Redistributables are in. Defaults to "VcRedists".
Optionally specifiy a name for the PSDrive to use when connecting to the MDT deployment share.
Optionally specify a publisher string to use in the MDT application. Defaults to "Microsoft".
Optionally specify a custom name for the MDT bundle. Defaults to "Visual C++ Redistributables".
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-VcList | Save-VcRedist -Path C:\Temp\VcRedist Update-VcMdtApplication -VcList (Get-VcList) -Path C:\Temp\VcRedist -MdtPath \\server\deployment Update-VcMdtBundle -MdtPath \\server\deployment

dev:remarks.maml:para: Description: Retrieves the list of Visual C++ Redistributables, downloads them to C:\Temp\VcRedist and updates each Redistributable in the MDT deployment share at \server\deployment.

maml:navigationLink.maml:linkText: Update the Redistributables bundle in MDT:
